definition[0]: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself
example[0]: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
example[1]: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
example[2]: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
example[3]: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions, ’ he said.
example[4]: They suffer from the illusion that they cannot solve their problems.
definition[1]: something that seems to be different from the way it really is
example[5]: Credit creates the illusion that you can own things without paying for them.
example[6]: The mirrors in the room gave an illusion of greater space.
example[7]: He was unlikely to be satisfied with the illusion of power.
